definition: lit. people shouting and horses neighing (idiom)/fig. tumultuous/hubbub
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
small craftsman (contemptuous)/clatter (e.g. of footsteps)/jumbled mass/press of bodies/tumult
to shake heaven and earth (idiom)
rumble
noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
sound of a drum/drumbeat
noise/din
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
gonfanon/banner
ear-splitting
sound of gong
to shout
a confused noise/a racket
battle formation
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. cries of grief shake the heavens/great sorrow (idiom)
sound of gunfire/fig. news of momentous events
